meaningMnemonic: Nicely <kanji>bake</kanji>d <kanji>meat</kanji> is <vocabulary>grilled meat</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>yakiniku</vocabulary>. Mmm, yum! If you go to Japan look out for 焼肉 places (same meaning and reading). They're pretty tasty, if you're into meat at least.
readingMnemonic: 焼き uses the reading you learned with the kanji. 肉 does too. Put them on the grill and enjoy!
